content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.145 - Executive order no. 145: establishing the position of state director of health, education and human services

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the effective and efficient development and
implementation of State policies and programs in health, education and human
services depends upon coordination among the Executive Chamber and the various
responsible State agencies, and upon cooperation among the State, local
governments and not-for- profit providers; WHEREAS, such coordination and cooperation are essential to
ensure that policy decisions by health, education and human services agencies
are sound and consistent with interagency objectives, and that resources for
health, education and human services are fully maximized and appropriately
allocated; WHEREAS, to promote these objectives, it is desirable that
one person, designated by the Governor, assume primary responsibility and
accountability for oversight and coordination of State health, education and
human services policies and programs, and for fostering cooperation among the

State, local governments and not-for-profit providers; and
NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby establish the position of State Director of

Health, Education and Human Services. I. Powers and Responsibilities

The State Director of Health, Education and Human Services
shall: assume primary responsibility for the oversight and
coordination of State policies and programs among the Executive Chamber and
health, education and human services agencies; assume primary responsibility for fostering cooperation
among the State, local governments and not-for-profit providers with respect to
health, education and human services; advise the Governor in connection with health, education
and human services matters; identify statewide health, education and human services
priorities and objectives; coordinate programmatic and fiscal initiatives for State
health, education and human services agencies; serve as Chair of the Health and Human Services Subcabinet; and act as the Governor's liaison to the Federal Government, other states, local governments, not- for-profit providers and advocacy groups within New

York State, in connection with matters relating to health, education and human
services. II. Personnel and

Resources

The State Director of Health, Education and Human Services
shall be authorized to use existing staff and resources of State agencies, which are hereby directed to render full cooperation and assistance to the

Director. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: June 27, 1991
